availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph B, Cooper (Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, coach maker)

body.p: Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, coach maker. New Jersey native. Married to Susan Guerin Cooper in Morris County, New Jersey on February 28, 1837. Father of Elizabeth Cooper, John Cooper, William Cooper, Sarah Cooper, Jennie Cooper, and Henry Cooper. Coach maker in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Coach maker in Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 208B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 428.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 2, p. 208A.
"Joseph B. Cooper," (1802-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial 61721852, accessed May 30, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/61721852.
New Jersey, U.S., Marriage Records, 1670-1965, New Jersey State Archives, Trenton, NJ, Morris County, Film 004541274.
